2020-08-16T15:05:24Z: And that's that for this second triple-header! Enjoy the rest of your weekend, and we'll see you in two weeks for Spa-Francorchamps fun. Bye!
2020-08-16T15:04:41Z: And here's the report: F1 Spanish GP: Hamilton storms to victory ahead of VerstappenLewis Hamilton dominated the Spanish Grand Prix to win ahead of Max Verstappen and extend his Formula 1 world championship lead, as Valtteri Bottas's slow start cost him second
2020-08-16T15:03:57Z: and the bottom 10: 11. Ricciardo, 12. Kvyat, 13. Ocon, 14. Raikkonen, 15. Magnussen, 16. Giovinazzi, 17. Russell, 18. Latifi, 19. Grosjean, DNF. Leclerc
2020-08-16T15:03:10Z: The final order, then: 1. Hamilton, 2. Verstappen, 3. Bottas, 4. Stroll, 5. Perez, 6. Sainz, 7. Vettel, 8. Albon, 9. Gasly, 10. Norris
2020-08-16T14:58:23Z: Hamilton, Verstappen and Bottas take their places on the podium.
2020-08-16T14:51:53Z: That race will surely go down as...one of the many grands prix that F1 has had in its lifetime. That's probably about it for plaudits.
2020-08-16T14:47:08Z: Vettel, Albon, Gasly and Norris complete the top 10.
2020-08-16T14:46:52Z: Stroll gets shuffled up to fourth after Perez's penalty, who hangs on from Sainz in sixth.
2020-08-16T14:46:09Z: Verstappen crosses the line 24 seconds later to claim second place, as Bottas smashes in a 1m18.183s to claim the extra point.
2020-08-16T14:45:19Z: TV replays explain the reason behind Grosjean's late stop, as he saves a spin coming out of Turn 8 but the slide wrecks his tyres in the process. Not a good end to the race for the Haas driver.
2020-08-16T14:45:18Z: And Lewis Hamilton crosses the line to win the Spanish Grand Prix!
2020-08-16T14:44:09Z: Bottas is coming in for new tyres, presumably to cement the fastest lap. He's got over a minute's advantage over Perez...
2020-08-16T14:43:20Z: With two laps to go Grosjean has pitted to drop him to last place.
2020-08-16T14:41:54Z: Bottas did a 1m19.750s to potentially steal the fastest-lap point.
2020-08-16T14:39:42Z: Hamilton's gap over Verstappen is 17s, so it's something of a rout here by the Mercedes ace.
2020-08-16T14:38:40Z: We wanted spice earlier - we thought the rain could add a dash of it. But it's just not turned up, and we're still in the racing equivalent of a korma. Kormula 1, as it were.
2020-08-16T14:37:24Z: Sainz gets ahead of Vettel with the aid of DRS on the main straight to climb up to P6. Things are about to get worse for the Ferrari driver with Albon now directly behind him on track.
2020-08-16T14:36:56Z: Sainz has now cleared Vettel, cracking open DRS and storming past the floundering Ferrari.
2020-08-16T14:34:18Z: Stroll's now cruising up on the back of Perez, and should be in a net fourth very soon with Perez's penalty.
2020-08-16T14:33:08Z: Make that IN DRS range now, and Stroll steals past into turn 1 at the start of his 57th lap. P5 is his.
2020-08-16T14:32:22Z: There it is, Kvyat is handed a five second penalty for ignoring blue flags, the same punishment as Perez earlier.
2020-08-16T14:32:00Z: Stroll's now almost in DRS range of Vettel now, so the Ferrari driver will be under pressure shortly.
2020-08-16T14:31:28Z: Kvyat is the latest driver to be put under investigation for ignoring blue flags. The Russian is currently P12 but is 14 seconds ahead of Magnussen behind him so if he gets a penalty it won't hurt him too much.
2020-08-16T14:29:15Z: A five second penalty for Perez, then, for ignoring the blue flags earlier. He's currently 6s ahead of Vettel, which is enough to keep P4 for now.
2020-08-16T14:25:15Z: Perez, meanwhile, is being investigated for a blue flag infraction.
2020-08-16T14:24:50Z: Hamilton rejoins behind Albon, but he'll re-lap him in short order.
2020-08-16T14:22:14Z: Bottas comes in for soft tyres for his final stint - weather permitting. He rejoins in third, behind Verstappen.
2020-08-16T14:21:35Z: Perez, in fourth, is close to being lapped.
2020-08-16T14:20:24Z: We must be using the US postal system today, because not many drivers have been able to send it in this race...
2020-08-16T14:19:59Z: Despite all his struggles recently, Vettel is closing in on a solid race. Having started on the medium tyre he is up to fifth now running on the softs but probably has to pit again. But with fresher tyres at the end of the race he should be able to fight his way up the order late on.
2020-08-16T14:19:15Z: Kvyat pits from fifth, rejoining behind the 11th-placed Ricciardo.
2020-08-16T14:17:33Z: Hamilton does a 1m21.539s to extend his advantage.
2020-08-16T14:16:50Z: Hamilton has responded to Bottas' previously quick times, and the gap is now 14.5s between the Mercs.
2020-08-16T14:14:38Z: Stroll is pitting again, taking the soft tyre for the final 22 laps.
2020-08-16T14:14:01Z: Bottas sets a 1m21.857s to eat into Hamilton's now-12s lead.
2020-08-16T14:13:19Z: And Verstappen's come in for another set of tyres, it's a fresh set of mediums. He rejoins ahead of Stroll, who's several cubits behind the front three.
2020-08-16T14:11:40Z: The experiment on hard tyres hasn't worked for Red Bull and Albon as he pits for a second time to switch to the mediums.
2020-08-16T14:11:17Z: Lap 41, and Hamilton has opened the gap to Verstappen to 10 seconds. Bottas is just 2s behind the Red Bull.
2020-08-16T14:10:44Z: Leclerc heads into the pits and it looks like his Ferrari seatbelts have come loose in his cockpit. Whatever the reason, he is retired from the race.
2020-08-16T14:04:59Z: Ocon duly pits at the end of Lap 35 to release Norris from the attention of Leclerc.
2020-08-16T14:04:20Z: And Ricciardo has now elected to stop, taking a set of soft tyres and emerging in seventh place.
2020-08-16T14:03:45Z: With Ocon blocking the road for Norris it invites Leclerc to attack the McLaren driver, which provides some terrific action between Turns 3-10 but the Ferrari driver cannot find a way ahead.
2020-08-16T14:03:38Z: Ricciardo has been overtaken by Stroll for fourth place - the Renault driver has yet to stop.
2020-08-16T14:01:39Z: Hellooooo, grey clouds! Fancy making your way over to the circuit?
2020-08-16T14:01:29Z: Albon gets ahead of Ocon, who is still yet to stop in this race, with a DRS-assisted move around the outside at the first corner for P8.
2020-08-16T13:59:42Z: A scrap between the Racing Points now - Perez gets within a whisker of passing Stroll into turn 1, but the Canadian holds on.
2020-08-16T13:59:33Z: The mix of strategies is providing plenty of on-track action now with different cars enjoying or suffering different tyre life stages. Leclerc, on fresh mediums, is hounding Norris on worn softs for P11 but can't find a way past as the race hits the halfway point.
2020-08-16T13:58:46Z: We're now officially at half-distance, as Hamilton begins Lap 33.
2020-08-16T13:57:58Z: But Perez comes back at Sainz, draws alongside at T1 and powers past a lap after his stop. A strong move to overpower the home hero.
2020-08-16T13:56:58Z: This has worked out nicely for Sainz, who clears Perez having committed to another set of softs. P6 for the McLaren driver.
2020-08-16T13:56:13Z: Perez, too, is in the pits. Mediums for him as well - can the Racing Points do this on one stop?
2020-08-16T13:56:07Z: Sainz, on the softs, then gets ahead of Albon on the unfancied hard tyres. Once those ahead take their first stops that will become a net sixth place.
2020-08-16T13:54:52Z: Ocon gets by Magnussen at the first corner and, just like they did against Raikkonen earlier, Albon follows him by at turn three. The Haas driver's tyres are done as Sainz also gets ahead two corners later. Magnussen, tail between his legs, pits at the end of the lap.
2020-08-16T13:53:33Z: Stroll pits from fourth, and emerges in eighth ahead of Ocon and Albon.
2020-08-16T13:51:19Z: So, now we play the waiting game. Ah, the waiting game sucks - let's play Hungry Hungry Hippos.
2020-08-16T13:50:06Z: Albon's become a bit of a sacrificial lamb on those hard tyres. And, like Friday, those tyres still look awful around here.
2020-08-16T13:47:25Z: Verstappen comes out ahead of Bottas, then, and just 4.3s behind Hamilton.
2020-08-16T13:46:38Z: Sainz's Plan A is to take a fresh set of soft tyres at his first stop, meaning he will switch to the mediums for his second stop later in the race. He rejoins the action in P12.
2020-08-16T13:46:37Z: And here we are, Hamilton will stop this time for mediums. Mercedes double-stacks, putting Bottas on the same tyres.
2020-08-16T13:44:38Z: Licking his wounds after being overtaken by two cars in one lap, Raikkonen pits and returns to the action in last place.
2020-08-16T13:44:34Z: Verstappen gets new tyres, taking some mediums, all but confirming a two-stop. A 1.9s stop, which is quite unbelievable.
2020-08-16T13:43:15Z: A challenge for position! That's woken this race up a little, with Ocon diving down the inside of Raikkonen at the first corner having closed up with the aid of DRS. That tussle invites Albon into the action, having pitted for hard tyres two laps earlier, and he gets around Raikkonen at turn three.
2020-08-16T13:42:21Z: Verstappen tells his race engineer that he wants new tyres rather than wind information. He's dropped 7.1s behind Hamilton now.
2020-08-16T13:39:20Z: So, Albon opting for the one stop presumably. They've got to do something different to clear the Racing Points. He rejoins in 16th.
2020-08-16T13:36:46Z: It's lap 16 now - Hamilton is 4s ahead of Verstappen, with a fastest lap of a 1m22.767s. Bottas is 2.4s off Verstappen, who has 12.4s in hand over Stroll.
2020-08-16T13:35:45Z: For the last three laps Kvyat has had three runs down the main straight with DRS but just can't get close enough to torpedo down the inside of Vettel at the first corner.
2020-08-16T13:33:04Z: If this race was a curry, it'd be a korma right now. We're in need of spice to kick it up to bhuna level at the very least.
2020-08-16T13:32:33Z: Vettel remains the highest runner who started on the medium tyres in 11th place, having had a free pick after missing Q3, but is coming under pressure from Kvyat who is on the softs and within DRS range.
2020-08-16T13:31:53Z: A new fastest lap for Hamilton, a 1m23.067s, so he's unlocked some extra pace.
2020-08-16T13:30:58Z: Albon's dropped off of Perez by an extra second, presumably to revert to tyre management mode.
2020-08-16T13:27:15Z: It's always been difficult to pass here, and that's because you lose a lot of ground on the infield section. Albon's closing in on Perez, but can't make any inroads in the infield.
2020-08-16T13:22:32Z: Bottas now does a 1m23.796s on lap 5, freed up by Stroll in a bid to catch up to Verstappen.
2020-08-16T13:21:39Z: REPLAY: A very good start from Gasly then, managed to get up as far as seventh before Sainz covered him back off and reclaimed the place.
2020-08-16T13:20:53Z: Bottas now clears Stroll this time around, getting past at the start of Lap 5 into T1 with DRS.
2020-08-16T13:20:03Z: Leclerc's still stuck on Gasly like a limpet, hanging onto the back of the AlphaTauri.
2020-08-16T13:19:07Z: Bottas has the DRS open, but Stroll holds the line into T1 and holds the Mercedes off! Good defending from the Canadian.
2020-08-16T13:17:59Z: First benchmark of 1m24.630s from Hamilton, then. Verstappen's 1.4s off the Mercedes, and Stroll's a further 1.8s back
2020-08-16T13:16:35Z: Stunning move from Kvyat, around the outside of Ricciardo at Turn 4!
2020-08-16T13:15:47Z: Leclerc has lost ground to Gasly at Turn 10, as Norris has dropped to 10th on that opening tour.
2020-08-16T13:15:21Z: Perez was also close to clearing Bottas there, and Albon was very close to the back of the #77 car into turn 2.
2020-08-16T13:14:52Z: Bottas has a sluggish start, and Verstappen and Stroll both clear the Mercedes! Hamilton scampers off into the lead.
2020-08-16T13:13:45Z: And the Spanish Grand Prix is go, go, go!
2020-08-16T13:12:56Z: The drivers now begin to line up for the full start, having hopefully grabbed a bit of heat for those tyres.
2020-08-16T13:10:36Z: We're underway for the formation lap.
2020-08-16T13:10:02Z: We can imagine most will be attempting to avoid the hard tyre, as a number of drivers really struggled in FP2 on them. So, two stops? A wild one-stop attempt if the softs can hang on?
2020-08-16T13:09:09Z: Some tyre news, then - the top 10, Kvyat, Magnussen and Russell all start on softs. The rest begin on mediums.
2020-08-16T13:03:23Z: The grass at the edge of the circuit looks horrendously dried out - this is where Bernie's sprinklers could have come in handy.
2020-08-16T13:01:34Z: There's a 20 percent risk of rain for this encounter - an air temp of 30 degrees C and a track temp of 48.7 degrees C.
2020-08-16T12:59:47Z: Ten minutes, then, until the start of the race. You have five minutes to grab a cuppa, a sandwich and any other sofa rations you need.
2020-08-16T12:55:42Z: We've got an all-Mercedes front row, however, with Verstappen and Perez lurking on the second row - ready to pick up any pieces.
2020-08-16T12:51:14Z: Whichever way you cut it, tyre pain in Spain could send your race mainly down the drain.
2020-08-16T12:50:46Z: Mercedes boss Toto Wolff suggested that Verstappen would be the man to beat if tyre deg IS an issue - gamesmanship, or an honest assessment?
2020-08-16T12:49:47Z: What's going to happen in this Spanish GP? If you watched the F2 race this morning, there was huge tyre degradation - and this may yet be a factor once more this afternoon at the big-kid table.
2020-08-16T12:45:10Z: If you've been keeping an eye on the MotoGP, there was an absolutely horrific shunt in the Austrian GP. We hope both riders affected are okay - they were both up and walking.
2020-08-16T12:44:04Z: Good afternoon everyone - welcome, as always, to our Autosport Live feed ahead of the Spanish Grand Prix!
